intro: Pedicularis hausmannii, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers, which bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at high elevations. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native environment.
